content: In test "Only certain pieces", why is the knight not capturing all the queens?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte cette contribution parce que ce jeux peut bien aider les développeurs à s'améliorer

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle

Hi.
took time to do it, about 100 lines of structured functional c code.
My solution computes only the first Nuke. You should precise the behavior, if there is more than one nuke as input. (maybe each opponent piece can be captured only once)
My solution returns 0, if there is no Nuke. You should also precise this behavior.
For non chessplayers you might need to clarify that the knight cannot capture your own pieces.

Chess forever <3 thank you!
Some tests that can be added:
- our white knight targeting 8 black knights
- our knight on a2, f8 and b7 aiming at testing all "knight-critical" squares on different corners: on the "h1 corner", these squares are h1 (ok, tested in "In the corner"), g1, f1, g2 and f2 (ok, tested in "Nowhere to go" case)
- and of course:
    * an empty-but-our-knight chessboard
    * a full chessboard (my dream is only 63 queens lol)
    * a full-but-squares-the-knight-targets chessboard

For chess lovers, chess without king is not completely chess lol One can add the black king "k" on the board, with value "infinity", and ask to output "infinity" if our knight checks the king, whatever other pieces are under attack. (To keep in the spirit of the puzzle, ignore the chess-illegal case where the knight checks and all squares he targets are occupied)

Nice problem!
You may also add a test where the knight is completely trapped (he has nowhere to go because of your pieces).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good description and chess is always a good idea for an exercice.

Goal section
* Suggest to format "N", "p", "n", "b", "r" and "q" as {{constants}}.
* You may remove the quotation marks around N if you have formatted it as a constant.

Input section
* Please add this above your original description:
<<8 lines:>> Each line is a string [[row]] which represents a row of the chessboard and the pieces (if any) on the row.

* Suggest to format "." and "N" as {{constants}} instead of `monospace`.

Constraints section
* I think you may remove "Output is always <= 72."

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.
Hi! Thanks for your feedback, but do you really think that these test cases are necessary to ensure that someone can solve the puzzle?
